item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, April 21, 2025 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Blog hosted on a Nintendo Wii (292 points | 47 comments)
2. Show HN: Dia, an open-weights TTS model for generating realistic dialogue (272 points | 69 comments)
3. Astronomers confirm the existence of a lone black hole (75 points | 60 comments)
4. Ultra-precision formation flying demonstration for space-based interferometry (8 points | discuss)
5. Visiting – Epic (32 points | 17 comments)
6. Launch HN: Magic Patterns (YC W23) – AI Design and Prototyping for Product Teams (99 points | 56 comments)
7. Pydrofoil: Accelerating Sail-based instruction set simulators (3 points | discuss)
8. Cekura (Formerly Vocera) (YC F24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
9. Show HN: Open Codex – OpenAI Codex CLI with open-source LLMs (33 points | 20 comments)
10. Pipelining might be my favorite programming language feature (224 points | 186 comments)
11. The Value of Differences: Jennifer Lindsay on Noticing Translation (16 points | 2 comments)
12. A M.2 HDMI capture card (20 points | 1 comment)
13. Local LLM inference – impressive but too hard to work with (46 points | 33 comments)
14. FTC takes action against Uber for deceptive billing and cancellation practices (235 points | 105 comments)
15. Is 1 Prime, and Does It Matter? (50 points | 66 comments)
16. Optimizing Heap Allocations in Go: A Case Study (34 points | 5 comments)
17. An update to our pricing (73 points | 46 comments)
18. Dumb statistical models, always making people look bad (55 points | 8 comments)
19. Python’s new t-strings (526 points | 401 comments)
20. How I use Kate editor (117 points | 24 comments)
21. Adding keyword parameters to Tcl procs (39 points | 12 comments)
22. Getting forked by Microsoft (1493 points | 778 comments)
23. Thieves took their iPhones. Apple won't give their digital lives back (66 points | 49 comments)
24. AI assisted search-based research works now (100 points | 49 comments)
25. Out of the Fog (124 points | 28 comments)
26. Tabular Programming: A New Paradigm for Expressive Computing (66 points | 15 comments)
27. Reworking 30 lines of Linux code could cut power use by up to 30 percent (238 points | 82 comments)
28. Lichens can survive almost anything, and some might survive Mars (11 points | 3 comments)
29. Ask HN: Writing an Interpreter in Go or Crafting Interpreters? (9 points | 2 comments)
30. Propositional Parlor Puzzle (17 points | 1 comment)
